result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Allen Berg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph Allen Berg is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph Allen Berg was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to Count 2 in 15CF173.
Court dismisses Counts 1, 3 and 4.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: to Count 2 in 15CF173

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF199.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF199.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Ashlyn B. or Carol B. The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes:

Defendant sentenced to jail as a condition of probation.
Huber granted for work.
Concurrent with: to Count 2 15CF173

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Eric J. Lundell May 17, 2018 - amend credit.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
-Court holds open jail credit, Aty Skatrud to calculate within 10 days and ADA McKinley to respond within 5 days.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 15CF173

superMiscConds.notes:
-Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
-Complete programming as recommended by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Convert unpaid costs into a civil judgment and withhold payments from prison wages.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Rohan. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Arne Richard Skatrud   DF:  Joseph Allen Berg appeared from jail. Case called at 2:10 pm. Sentencing after Revocation on 15CF173 and 15CF199. Sentencing hearing on 17CF262. Court notes 15CF199 is assigned to Branch 1, counsel does not object to Branch 4 hearing case. ADA McKinely gives joint recommendation for resolution. Atty Skatrud addresses Court and requests Court adopt joint recommendation. Court reads charges and maximum penalities. Court issues sentence:

17CF262 Ct 1 - 9 mos jail concurrent to 15CF173 Ct 2 and 15CF199 Ct 2
- Court costs $268
- DNA sample and surcharge $250

15CF173 Ct 2 - 4 year total sentence, 2 years incarceration, 2 years extended supervision, concurrent to 15CF199 Ct 2 with conditions:
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Absolute sobriety
- AODA and follow through with recommended treatment
- Complete programming recommended by COMPAS and DOC
- convert unpaid costs to civil judgment and withhold payment from prison wages

15CF199 Ct 2 - 4 year total sentence, 2 years incarceration, 2 years extended supervision, concurrent to 15CF173 Ct 2 with conditions:
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Absolute sobriety
- AODA and follow through with recommended treatment
- Complete programming recommended by COMPAS and DOC
- convert unpaid costs to civil judgment and withhold payment from prison wages

DEF is eligible for CIP and ERP
Court holds open jail credit, Atty Skatrud to calculate within 10 days, ADA McKinley to respond within 5 days. Court will determine days credit for each case.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 9, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
filed by Agent Allen Matheus. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY: Alex Stormont, DF: Joseph Allen Berg appeared from jail.  Court called at 3:27 p.m. Set for PTC.  Includes case 15CF173 & 15CF199.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Wavier of Rights Form.   Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2 in 15CF173.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2 in 15CF173.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2 in 15CF199.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2 in 15CF199. On motion of the State, Crt reads in and dismisses Ct 1, Ct 3, Ct 4, Ct5, & Ct. 6 in 15CF173 & Ct. 1, Ct. 3 & Ct. 4 in 15CF199.   Victims rights have been complied with.  Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement.  Crt orders:  

Ct. 2 in 15CF199 and Ct 2 in 15CF173 to run concurrent to each other
W/S 3 years probation with conditions
- DE is sentenced to 1 year in the St. Croix County Jail 
- 60 days credit for time served.
- Huber is granted for work
- AODA with follow through
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-   DE is hereby ordered, as a condition the defendant have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons, Ashlyn B. and Carol B.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  
- Court costs of $268 and $250 for DNA surcharge
- Court costs of $243.00 and $200 for DNA surcharge
- DE to pay through DOC
- Restitution for an amount to be determined within 60 days from todays hearing
- 20 days to appeal

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kevin H. Gehler, DF ATTY: Alex Stormont, DF: Joseph Allen Berg appeared from jail.  Court called at 2:00 p.m.  Includes case 15CF173 & 15CF199.  ADA Gehler advises DE is still working on getting into a treatment facility.  Victim is present in court and is asking for the no contact to be modified.  Bond is modified.  Court adjourned.  lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kevin H. Gehler,  DF ATTY: Alex Stormont, DF: Joseph Allen Berg appeared from jail.  Court called at 11:05 a.m.  Includes case 15CF173 (PTC) & 15CF199 (arraignment).  Proceed with arraignment on 15CF199.  Court informs DE of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty on all counts.  Not Guilty pleas are entered.  Attorney Stormont advises the court working on getting the DE into a treatment facility that is affordable.  Set out for PTC on both files.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 11:10 a.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif
Pre-trial conference on May 11, 2015 at 11:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kevin H. Gehler, DF ATTY: Alex Stormont, DF: Joseph Allen Berg appeared from jail.  Court called at 9:24 a.m.  Includes case 15CF173 & 15CF199.  Set for Preliminary Hearing.  DE files with the court the Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver.  Court questions the DE.  Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony occurred and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 9:27 a.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Appointing Atty Stormont. km
Preliminary hearing on May 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.

--Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Carol B.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.


-Report every  Wednesday and Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
